words.definition: a creature from a different world
words.example: The alien came in peace.

words.definition: surrounded by or in the middle of
words.example: There was a red apple among the green ones.

words.definition: a list of information
words.example: We used a chart to see how we had improved.

words.definition: a group of water drops in the sky
words.example: The sky was filled with white clouds.

words.definition: to understand something
words.example: Henry could not comprehend the message.

words.definition: to say what someone or something is like
words.example: They described their tree as colorful with gold ribbon and a star.

words.definition: at any time
words.example: Going skiing last winter was the most fun I've ever had.

words.definition: to not succeed in what you try to do
words.example: Since he failed to get the job, he was sad.

words.definition: behaving in a pleasant, kind way
words.example: The friendly animals came up to the girl.

words.definition: a score or mark given to someone's work
words.example: I managed to get good grades on my report card.

words.definition: in place of
words.example: He ate the carrot instead of the ice cream.

words.definition: a place where you go to read books
words.example: The library at school is full of books.

words.definition: a large round thing in space
words.example: Saturn is the planet with the ring around it.

words.definition: something students write for school
words.example: Karen had trouble writing her report.

words.definition: more than two but not many
words.example: He had to read several books for class.

words.definition: to find an answer to something
words.example: All the students could easily solve the math problem.

words.definition: happening quickly and unexpectedly
words.example: I was suddenly surprised by the cake my friends brought me.

words.definition: to guess or think something
words.example: I suppose I should go home now.

words.definition: all objects in space
words.example: The universe is so large that it cannot be measured.

words.definition: to look at something
words.example: Michael likes to view himself in the mirror.
